column4: I believe my BIOS supports booting from from an external USB device. However I cannot get it to work. It's a Pheonix AwardBIOS. Any suggestions?
go into your bios and make sure that boot from USB is enabled and add USB device to the boot sequence
I don't have that. All that is available is Removable in Advanced Settings boot sequence
put the removable 1st in the list
it is - at the top!
strange, i cant help you in anymore detail, but i remember reading somewhere recently that if the sector??  size is wrong you cant use it as a boot device
sector size of the bootable media? How do I set that for CD images and USB pendrives?
is it a HD or flash memory?
tried usb flash pendrive and cd image on external usb cd-rom (just to test)
what OS are you trying to boot
gutsy
http://www.pendrivelinux.com/2007/09/28/usb-ubuntu-710-gutsy-gibbon-install/
followed that
problem appears to be with BIOS if I can't boot from cd-rom
you cant boot with optical media either?
exactly
can you update you bios? or reflash it?
it's a brand new machine....I can look for an update but I doubt it'll fix this
i wish i could help you more but if your bios settings are correct and you followed the instructions in the guide I dont really know what else to suggest
can anyone tell me how to enable search for my root directory?
thanks...I'm stumped too
